Chapter 5: On Practice ÅšÄriputra's Abhidharma Treatise, Section on Origins, Chapter 5 on Practice: bodily action, verbal action, mental action, realms.
What is bodily action?
It is inhalation and exhalation, this is called bodily action.
What is verbal action?
It is initial and sustained thought, this is called verbal action.
What is mental action?
It is ideation and volition, this is called mental action.
The realm of bodily action is from the body with inhalation and exhalation up to the fourth dhyÄna, this is called the realm of bodily action.
What is not the realm of bodily action?
The body without inhalation and exhalation, the fourth dhyÄna or beyond, this is called not the realm of bodily action.
What is the realm of verbal action?
The mental consciousness of the desire realm, the indeterminate of the form realm, the first dhyÄna and the intermediate state of the first dhyÄna, this is called the realm of verbal action.
What is not the realm of verbal action?
The five groups of consciousness, the second dhyÄna or beyond, this is called not the realm of verbal action.
What is the realm of mental action?
Excluding the two concentrations and the one life, the rest are called the realm of mental activity.
What is not the realm of mental activity?
The two concentrations and the one life are called not the realm of mental activity.
Where does bodily activity arise and cease?
From a body without inhalation and exhalation to a body with inhalation and exhalation, or from arising in the fourth meditation, bodily activity arises and ceases in this place.
Where does bodily activity cease and not arise?
From a body with inhalation and exhalation to a body without inhalation and exhalation, or entering the fourth meditation, bodily activity ceases and does not arise in this place.
Where does bodily activity arise and cease?
Where there is inhalation and exhalation, bodily activity arises and ceases in this place.
Where does bodily activity neither arise nor cease?
In a body without inhalation and exhalation, or in the fourth meditation or beyond, this is called bodily activity neither arising nor ceasing.
Where does verbal activity arise and cease?
From leaving the five consciousnesses to the mental consciousness, from arising from the second dhyÄna, in this place, verbal activity arises and does not cease.
In what place does verbal activity cease and not arise?
From leaving the mental consciousness to the five consciousnesses, if entering the second dhyÄna, in this place, verbal activity ceases and does not arise.
In what place does verbal activity arise and cease?
In the place with initial and sustained thought, in this place, verbal activity arises and ceases.
In what place does verbal activity not arise or cease?
In the five consciousnesses, in the second dhyÄna or beyond, in this place, verbal activity does not arise or cease.
In what place does mental activity arise and not cease?
From arising from the two concentrations or at the end of life, in this place, mental activity arises and does not cease.
In what place does mental activity cease and not arise?
If entering the two concentrations or at the end of life, in this place, mental activity ceases and does not arise.
In what place does mental activity arise and cease?
If the mind operates, the arising and ceasing of the mind's operation occurs in this place.
In what place does the mind's operation not arise or cease?
If in the two meditative absorptions up to the place of single birth, in this place the mind's operation does not arise or cease.

Now, I will collect the provisional gate of contact.
Bodily contact, mental contact, up to the eighteen kinds of contact, are called the dharma of contact.
What is bodily contact?
If contact is associated with the body consciousness, this is called bodily contact.
What is mental contact?
If contact is associated with the mind consciousness, this is called mental contact.
Furthermore, if it is associated with the five consciousnesses, the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses, this is called bodily contact.
If it is associated with the mind, thought, and consciousness, this is called mental contact.
What is called contact?
If it is a mental contact, it is called a name contact.
What is a tangible contact?
If it is a bodily contact, it is called a tangible contact.
What is a contact of craving?
If it is a contact associated with sensual desire, it is called a contact of craving.
What is a contact of anger?
If it is a contact associated with irritation, it is called a contact of anger.
What is a contact of wisdom?
If it is a contact associated with noble wisdom, it is called a contact of wisdom.
What is a contact of ignorance?
If it is an unwholesome contact not associated with wisdom, it is called a contact of ignorance.
What is a contact of the bright side?
If a contact arises from the bright side and wisdom can make it expand, it is called a contact of the bright side.
What is a contact of the dark side?
If a contact arises from the dark side and ignorance can make it expand, it is called a contact of the dark side.
Furthermore, if a contact is associated with noble patience, it is called a contact of the bright side.
If a contact is associated with non-noble afflictions, it is called a contact of the dark side.
Furthermore, if a contact gives rise to the attainment of the fruits of the path, it is called a contact associated with clear knowledge.
If a contact is not noble, whether wholesome or indeterminate, it is called a contact associated with ignorance.
What is a noble contact?
If a contact is uncontaminated, it is called a noble contact.
What is a non-noble contact?
If a contact is contaminated, it is called a non-noble contact.
What is a contaminated contact?
If a contact is defiled, it is called a contaminated contact.
What is an uncontaminated contact?
If a contact is undefiled, it is called an uncontaminated contact.
What is a defiled contact?
If a contact is accompanied by craving, it is called a defiled contact.
What is an undefiled contact?
If a contact is not accompanied by craving, it is called an undefiled contact.
What is a contact accompanied by craving?
If a contact is to be grasped at, it is called a contact accompanied by craving.
What is a contact not accompanied by craving?
If a contact is not to be grasped at, it is called a contact not accompanied by craving.
What is a contact to be grasped at?
If a touch has grasping, it is called a touch that will grasp in the future.
What is a touch that will not grasp in the future?
If a touch has no grasping, it is called a touch that will not grasp in the future.
What is a touch with grasping?
If a touch has superiority, it is called a touch with grasping.
What is a touch without grasping?
If a touch has no superiority, it is called a touch without grasping.
What is a touch with superiority?
If a touch has grasping, it is called a touch with superiority.

Not apart from those objects, if another mind resembles them, whether it has arisen, is arising, or will arise, it is called the mind-consciousness element.
Chapter 8: The Ten Unwholesome Courses of Action, Section on the Ten Unwholesome Courses of Action, in the Abhidharma Treatise of ÅšÄriputra Question:
How many are unwholesome courses of action?
Answer:
Ten.
From killing to wrong view.
What is killing?
If a person kills with an evil mind, without compassion, solely intent on killing, this is called killing.
What is stealing?
If a person steals other people's property in a village or in the mountains and forests, this is called stealing.
What is sexual misconduct?

If a woman is protected by her parents, brothers, sisters, herself, the Dharma, her clan, relatives, and even those who receive flower garlands, if one violates these, this is called sexual misconduct.
What is false speech?

If a person says they know when they do not know, says they do not know when they know, says they see when they do not see, says they do not see when they see, or tells lies for their own sake, for the sake of others, or for the sake of property, this is called false speech.
What is divisive speech?
If a person hears something here and goes there to speak, wanting to cause division between these people;
hears something there and comes here to speak, wanting to cause division between those people;
wants to break up those who are not yet broken up and cause those who are already broken up to completely disperse, and takes pleasure in separating others, this is called divisive speech.
What is harsh speech?
If a person speaks harshly and bitterly, and others do not rejoice or delight upon hearing it, this is called harsh speech.
What is frivolous speech?
If a person speaks untimely words, meaningless words, unlawful words, undisciplined words, and unpeaceful words, this is called frivolous speech.
What is covetousness?
If a person has a longing mind towards others' villages, towns, and wealth, wishing to make others' possessions one's own, this is called covetousness.
What is ill-will?
If a person is angry and wishes to bind, harm, and inflict various sufferings upon sentient beings, this is called ill-will.
What is wrong view?

If a person has wrong views, saying there is no giving, no sacrifice, no good or bad karmic retribution, no this world or other worlds, no parents, no gods, no sentient beings born through transformation, no Å›ramaá¹‡as or brÄhmaá¹‡as, this is called wrong view.ğŸ”½What is the cause of killing?
For whom is killing the cause?
Killing arises from causes of greed, hatred, and delusion, and from causes of mental and mental factors.

Killing is a cause for hell, animal, and hungry ghost realms, and a cause for poverty and lowliness among ghosts and humans. If one is reborn as a human due to remaining karma, one will have a short life.
What are the causes of theft?
For whom are they causes of theft?
Theft arises from causes of greed, up to causes of mental and mental factors.

Theft is a cause for hell, animal, and hungry ghost realms, and a cause for poverty and lowliness among ghosts and humans. If one is reborn as a human due to remaining karma, one's wealth will be squandered.
What are the causes of sexual misconduct?
For whom are they causes of sexual misconduct?
Sexual misconduct arises from causes of greed, up to causes of mental and mental factors.

Sexual misconduct is a cause for hell, animal, and hungry ghost realms, and a cause for poverty and lowliness among ghosts and humans. If one is reborn as a human due to remaining karma, one will be contentious.ğŸ”½What are the causes of false speech?
For whom are they causes of false speech?
Lying is caused by greed, up to the causes of mental activities.

Lying is the cause of hell, animals, and hungry ghosts, the cause of poverty among ghosts and humans. If one is reborn as a human in the remaining retribution, one is always slandered.ğŸ”½What are the causes of divisive speech?
For whom are divisive words the cause?
Divisive speech is caused by greed, up to the causes of mental activities.
For whom are divisive words the cause?

Divisive speech is the cause of hell, animals, and hungry ghosts, the cause of poverty among ghosts and humans. If one is reborn as a human in the remaining retribution, one's relatives and close friends will hate and destroy each other.
What are the causes of harsh speech?
For whom are harsh words the cause?
Harsh speech is caused by greed, up to the causes of mental activities.
For whom are harsh words the cause?
Harsh speech is the cause of hell, animals, and hungry ghosts, the cause of poverty among ghosts and humans. If one is reborn as a human in the remaining retribution, one hears unpleasant sounds.
What is the cause of frivolous speech?
For whom is frivolous speech a cause?
Frivolous speech is caused by greed, up to the mind and mental factors.
For whom is frivolous speech a cause?
It is the cause for hell, animals, hungry ghosts, ghosts, and poverty among humans. If the remaining retribution is born among humans, words are not valued.
What is the cause of lust?
For whom is lust a cause?
Lust is caused by bonds, by mental factors, and by the mind and mental factors.
For whom is lust a cause?
It is the cause for hell, animals, hungry ghosts, ghosts, and poverty among humans. If the remaining retribution is born among humans, there are many conditions.
What is the cause of anger?
For whom is anger a cause?
Anger is caused by bonds, by mental factors, and by the mind and mental factors.
For whom is anger a cause?

This is the cause for hell, animals, and hungry ghosts, the cause for poverty and lowliness among ghosts and humans, and if reborn as a human with remaining karma, one will have many enemies and those who hate them.
What is the cause of wrong views?
For whom are wrong views a cause?
Wrong views are caused by afflictions, by mental factors, and by the mind and mental factors.
For whom are wrong views a cause?

This is the cause for hell, animals, and hungry ghosts, the cause for poverty and lowliness among ghosts and humans, and if reborn as a human with remaining karma, one will consider what is wrong to be auspicious.
Chapter on the Ten Wholesome Courses of Action, ÅšÄriputra-abhidharma-Å›Ästra, Introductory Section, Chapter 9 on the Ten Wholesome Courses of Action, Question:
How many are wholesome courses of action?
Answer:
Ten.
What are the ten?
Not killing, up to right view.
What is meant by not killing?
If a person abstains from killing, abandons weapons and sticks, has a sense of shame, compassion, and pity for all sentient beings, this is called not killing.
What is meant by not stealing?
If a person abstains from stealing and does not steal others' possessions, this is called not stealing.
What is meant by not engaging in sexual misconduct?
If a person abstains from sexual misconduct and never engages in sexual relations with women who are protected by others, this is called not engaging in sexual misconduct.
What is meant by not lying?

If a person abstains from lying, and when asked if they know something they say they know if they know, and if they do not see something they say they do not see if they do not see, and they do not lie for their own sake, for the sake of others, or for the sake of wealth, this is called not lying.
What is meant by not engaging in divisive speech?
If a person abstains from divisive speech, what they hear here they do not tell there in an attempt to divide those there;

what they hear there they do not tell here in an attempt to divide those here. If there are those who are divided, they wish to reconcile them. Those who are already reconciled they wish to increase their joy and mutual entertainment. This is called not engaging in divisive speech.
What is meant by not engaging in harsh speech?
If a person abstains from harsh speech, from coarse and harsh words, and speaks soft and gentle words that are loved and delighted in by the people, this is called not speaking harshly.
What is meant by not engaging in frivolous speech?

If a person speaks at the right time, speaks the truth, speaks with meaning, speaks words that tame and subdue, speaks words that bring peace and tranquility, and speaks good words that accord with the time, this is called not engaging in frivolous speech.
What is meant by being without greed?
If a person abstains from greed, does not hope for the wealth of other villages and towns to become their own, this is called being without greed.
What is meant by being without hatred?
If a person abstains from the mind of hatred, does not wish for this sentient being to be harmed, bound, or to experience various sufferings, this is called being without hatred.
What is meant by right view?

If a person has right view, believes in giving and sacrifices, and even in this world there are Å›ramaá¹‡as, brÄhmaá¹‡as who have right view and right practice who have realized and know this world and the next world, this is called right view.ğŸ”½What is the cause of not killing?
For whom is not killing the cause?
Abstaining from killing has non-greed as its cause, non-hatred as its cause, non-delusion as its cause, and mind and mental factors as its cause.
For whom is abstaining from killing a cause?
It is a cause for experiencing happiness in the heavens and among humans, and for being reborn as a human with a long life.
By what cause does one abstain from stealing?
For whom is abstaining from stealing a cause?
Abstaining from stealing has non-greed as its cause, up to mind and mental factors as its cause.
Abstaining from stealing is a cause for experiencing happiness in the heavens and among humans, and for being reborn as a human with inexhaustible wealth.
By what cause does one abstain from sexual misconduct?
For whom is abstaining from sexual misconduct a cause?
Abstaining from sexual misconduct has non-greed as its cause, up to mind and mental factors as its cause.

Abstaining from sexual misconduct is a cause for experiencing happiness in the heavens and among humans, and for being reborn as a human without disputes.ğŸ”½By what cause does one abstain from false speech?
For whom is abstaining from false speech a cause?
Not lying is caused by non-greed, up to the causes of mental factors.

Not lying is the cause for experiencing happiness in the heavens and among humans. If one is reborn among humans as a result, one will not be slandered.ğŸ”½What is the cause of not engaging in divisive speech?
For whom is not engaging in divisive speech a cause?
Not engaging in divisive speech is caused by non-greed, up to the causes of mental factors.

Not engaging in divisive speech is the cause for experiencing happiness in the heavens and among humans. If one is reborn among humans as a result, one's relatives and close associates will be harmonious.
They will not hate or destroy each other.ğŸ”½What is the cause of not engaging in harsh speech?
For whom is not engaging in harsh speech a cause?
Not engaging in harsh speech is caused by non-greed, up to the causes of mental factors.
Not engaging in harsh speech is the cause for experiencing happiness in the heavens and among humans. If one is reborn among humans as a result, one will hear pleasant sounds.
What is the cause of not engaging in idle chatter?
For whom is not engaging in idle chatter a cause?
Not engaging in idle chatter is caused by non-greed, up to the causes of mental factors.
Non-frivolous speech is the cause for receiving happiness in the heavens and among humans. If one is reborn among humans as a result, one's words are considered valuable.
What is the cause of non-greed?
For whom is non-greed a cause?
Non-greed is caused by reverence, which is caused by the roots of goodness, which are caused by the mind and mental factors.
Non-greed is the cause for receiving happiness in the heavens and among humans. If one is reborn among humans as a result, one has no conditions for various affairs.
What is the cause of non-hatred?
For whom is non-hatred a cause?
Non-hatred is caused by reverence, up to the mind and mental factors.
Non-hatred is the cause for receiving happiness in the heavens and among humans. If one is reborn among humans as a result, one has few enemies and those who dislike one.
What is the cause of right view?
For whom is right view a cause?
Right view is caused by reverence, up to the mind and mental factors.
Right view is the cause for receiving happiness in the heavens and among humans. If one is reborn among humans as a result, one does not consider evil to be auspicious.
